alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Hennepin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 9:47PM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Mississippi River At Hwy 169 at Champlin affecting Hennepin and Anoka Counties. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt upstream snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Hwy 169 at Champlin. * WHEN...From Saturday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.6 feet, Anoka - water begins flooding Rice Street and Levee Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 930 PM CDT Wednesday, the stage was 7.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Saturday morning and continue rising to a crest of 15.5 feet early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.5 feet on 04/15/1952. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
